member.name: T:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Intuit.IPP.Diagnostics provides message logging feature. The assembly uses System.Trace as the default logger to log messages. It also provides an interface to use a third party logging frameworks such as, Enterprise Library, Log4Net and so forth. When using a third party logger, you should implement ILogger interface and assign instance of custom logging class to service context object.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.ILogger.Log(Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Logs messages depending on the ids trace level.

member.name: T:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel
member.summary: Specifies what level of messages to output.

member.name: F:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel.Off
member.summary: Output no tracing and debugging messages.

member.name: F:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel.Info
member.summary: Output informational messages, warnings, and error-handling messages.

member.name: F:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Output all debugging and tracing messages.

member.name: F:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLogger.traceSwitch
member.summary: Provides a multilevel switch to control tracing.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLogger.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TraceLogger class.

member.name: M:Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLogger.Log(Intuit.Ipp.Diagnostics.TraceLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Logs messages depending on the ids trace level.
